Description: Scarab in glazed composition, probably mould-made; underside decorated with hieroglyphic inscription arranged vertically: honeybee (for bit or bity) on neb-basket sign; pierced lengthwise; upper part broken away.
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Gardner (in Gardner 1888, pl. XVIII, no. 43). Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.134) (phase 3)
